titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Graduate Liberal Studies Records, 1982-2019 UA.24.02.0001

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2019-08-23 15:27:23 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The Duke Graduate Liberal Studies program was founded in 1984, under director Bonnie E. Erickson. The program grants a Master of Arts in Liberal studies (MALS) and is sometimes referred to as the MALS program. The materials include programs, curriculum development, faculty folders, photographs, slides, and correspondence.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Duke Graduate Liberal Studies program was founded in 1984, under director Bonnie E. Erickson. Additional previous directors include Diane Sasson and Donna Zapf. The program grants a Master of Arts in Liberal studies (MALS) and is sometimes referred to as the MALS program.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: Copyright for Official University records is held by Duke University; all other copyright is retained by the authors of items in these papers, or their descendants, as stipulated by United States copyright law.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Graduate Liberal Studies Records were received by the Duke University Archives as a transfer in 2019.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Graduate Liberal Studies Program, Duke University Archives, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Level 1 Accessioned and finding aid created from provided inventory by Tracy M. Jackson, 2019, August
Accessions described in this collection guide: UA2019.0038, UA2019.0042

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Contains records from Graduate Liberal Studies program, including records of previous director Diane Sasson and outgoing director Donna Zapf. Some records were left in GLS by Craufurd Goodwin. The materials include programs, curriculum development, faculty folders, photographs, slides, and correspondence.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: For a period of twenty-five years from the origin of the material, permission in writing from the office of origin and the University Archivist is required for use of administrative records. After twenty-five years, records that have been processed may be consulted with the permission of the University Archivist.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Materials have not been processed and must be screened for restricted contents before use.
